==== Turkey ==== The sons of [[Turkey]]'s Prime Minister, [[Binali Yıldırım]], are listed in the papers. The sons, both doing maritime business, have officially set up their 2 companies in [[Malta]], in order to avoid high Turkish tax rates.<ref>"[https://lovinmalta.com/news/news-breaking/four-things-the-paradise-papers-tells-us-about-malta Four Things The Paradise Papers Tells Us About Malta] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105215329/https://lovinmalta.com/news/news-breaking/four-things-the-paradise-papers-tells-us-about-malta |date=5 November 2017 }}". Lovin Malta. 5 November 2017.</ref> Both of the companies are registered under the names of the two sons, with the older son Erkam Yıldırım having more shares than the younger son Bülent Yıldırım in both companies. Companies, named Hawke Bay Marine Co. Ltd.(founded in 2004) and Black Eagle Marine Co. Ltd.(founded in 2007) are seen as "active" in the available detailed data.<ref>{{cite news|title=Paradise Belgeleri: Zenginler ve siyasetçilerin off-shore sırları|url=http://www.bbc.com/turkce/haberler-dunya-41880182|accessdate=15 November 2017|publisher=BBC Türkçe|date=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171114202158/http://www.bbc.com/turkce/haberler-dunya-41880182|archivedate=14 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== United Kingdom ==== {{multiple image|align=right|direction=horizontal|header= |header_align=center |header_background = | footer = | footer_align = left/right/center | footer_background = | width = | image1=Queen Elizabeth II March 2015 cropped.jpg |width1=129 |caption1=The Paradise Papers show that the [[Duchy of Lancaster]], a private estate of [[Queen Elizabeth II]], held investments in the [[Cayman Islands]] and [[Bermuda]].<ref name="ICIJ-20171105" />|image2=Charles, Prince of Wales at COP21.jpg |width2=129 |caption2=The Paradise Papers also show that the [[Duchy of Cornwall]], a possession of [[Charles, Prince of Wales|Prince Charles]], invested in a Bermuda-based carbon credits trading company.<ref name="theguardian.com">{{cite web |title=Prince Charles's estate made big profit on stake in friend's offshore firm |url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/07/prince-charles-profit-best-friend-hugh-van-cutsem-offshore-firm-paradise-papers |website= [[The Guardian]] |accessdate=7 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl= https://web.archive.org/web/20171107185936/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/07/prince-charles-profit-best-friend-hugh-van-cutsem-offshore-firm-paradise-papers |archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>}} [[File:Lord Sassoon, Commercial Secretary to the Treasury, at 'Planning for Infrastructure and Growth How to ensure London’s place in the global economy'.jpg|thumb|right|Lord Sassoon president of the international [[Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering]]]]
The papers show that the [[Duchy of Lancaster]], a private estate of [[Queen Elizabeth II]], held investments in two [[offshore financial centre]]s, the [[Cayman Islands]] and [[Bermuda]]. Both are [[British Overseas Territories]] of which she is monarch, and nominally appoints governors. Britain handles foreign policy for both islands to a large extent, but Bermuda has been self-governing since 1620. The Duchy's investments included [[First Quench Retailing]] off-licences and [[rent-to-own]] retailer [[BrightHouse (retailer)|BrightHouse]].<ref>{{cite web|last1=Osborne|first1=Hilary|title=Revealed: Queen's private estate invested millions of pounds offshore|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/05/revealed-queen-private-estate-invested-offshore-paradise-papers|publisher=''The Guardian''|access-date=5 November 2017|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105190200/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/05/revealed-queen-private-estate-invested-offshore-paradise-papers|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Labour Party Leader [[Jeremy Corbyn]] posited whether the Queen should apologize, saying anyone with money offshore for tax avoidance should "not just apologise for it, [but] recognise what it does to our society". A spokesman for the Duchy said that all of their investments are audited and legitimate and that the Queen voluntarily pays taxes on income she receives from Duchy investments.<ref name=beeb>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41883472|publisher=BBC|title=Paradise Papers: Queen should apologise, suggests Corbyn|date=6 November 2017|accessdate=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107042716/http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41883472|archivedate=7 November 2017}}</ref>
The papers also show that in June 2007, the [[Duchy of Cornwall]], a possession of [[Charles, Prince of Wales|Prince Charles]], invested $113,500 via in Sustainable Forestry Management,<ref name="theguardian.com"/> a Bermuda-based [[carbon credit]]s trading company run by [[Hugh van Cutsem]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Theresa May 'frustrated' at refusal of BBC and Guardian to hand over Paradise Papers evidence |url=https://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/11/07/theresa-may-frustrated-refusal-bbc-guardian-hand-paradise-papers|website=[[The Daily Telegraph]]|accessdate=7 November 2017|deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107211324/http://www.telegraph.co.uk/news/2017/11/07/theresa-may-frustrated-refusal-bbc-guardian-hand-paradise-papers|archivedate=7 November 2017}}</ref>
Four weeks after the Duchy of Cornwall purchased shares in Sustainable Forestry Management, Prince Charles made a speech criticising the [[European Union Emission Trading Scheme]] and the [[Kyoto Protocol]] for excluding carbon credits from [[rainforest]]s, and called for change.<ref>{{cite web|title=Paradise Papers: Prince Charles lobbied on climate policy after shares purchase|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41901175|website=[[BBC News]]|accessdate=7 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108003230/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-41901175|archivedate=8 November 2017}}</ref>
[[James Sassoon, Baron Sassoon|James Meyer Sassoon]], the 2007 president of the international [[Financial Action Task Force on Money Laundering]],<ref name=explore/><ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.finextra.com/pressarticle/14228/james-sassoon-to-act-as-president-of-financial-action-task-force|title=James Sassoon to act as president of financial action task force|first=|last=Finextra|date=3 April 2007|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109172213/https://www.finextra.com/pressarticle/14228/james-sassoon-to-act-as-president-of-financial-action-task-force|archivedate=9 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> said that his $236 million trust<ref>{{cite web|url=https://offshoreleaks.icij.org/stories/james-meyer-sassoon|title=James Meyer Sassoon – ICIJ Offshore Leaks Database|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107060231/https://offshoreleaks.icij.org/stories/james-meyer-sassoon|archivedate=7 November 2017}}</ref> revealed in the papers had been established years before by his grandmother with funds that had not been earned in the UK and therefore were not subject to tax there. He said he had first disclosed the trust when he joined the Treasury in 2002, where he was [[Commercial Secretary to the Treasury|Commercial Secretary]] from 2010 to 2013.{{citation needed|date=November 2017}}
An article published by the ICIJ detailing the use of ambiguous [[value-added tax|VAT]] policies on the [[Isle of Man]] highlights the $27 million [[Bombardier Challenger 600 series|Bombardier Challenger 605]] private jet that [[Lewis Hamilton]] registered there, apparently to become eligible for a $5.2 million VAT refund.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/offshore-gurus-help-rich-avoid-taxes-jets-yachts|title=Offshore Gurus Help Rich Avoid Taxes on Jets and Yachts: Buying a $27-million private jet or plush mega-yacht means millions in sales taxes—unless you know the right pro|author1=Juliette Garside|author2=Ryan Chittum|date=6 November 2017|accessdate=19 November 2017|publisher=International Consortium of Investigative Journalists|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107011942/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/offshore-gurus-help-rich-avoid-taxes-jets-yachts|archivedate=7 November 2017}}</ref>
The BBC also noted questions about investments by Conservative Party donor [[Michael Ashcroft]] and [[Farhad Moshiri]], owner of [[Everton F.C.|Everton Football Club]].<ref name=beeb />
Appleby has taken legal action against ''[[The Guardian]]'' and the ''[[BBC]]'' and this is widely seen as an attack on [[press freedom]]. For example, [[Jeremy Corbyn]] stated, "The Panama Papers and the Paradise Papers shone a powerful light on the absolute scandal of tax dodging. Knowledge is power and investigative reporters and whistleblowers bring into the open information that strengthens democratic debate about the type of society we want to live in. The more we know about the scale of, and techniques used for, tax dodging, the more we can develop policies to tackle this immoral scourge."<ref>{{cite news| url=https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/dec/19/jeremy-corbyn-leads-criticism-of-paradise-papers-legal-action| title=Jeremy Corbyn leads criticism of Paradise Papers legal action| publisher=[[The Guardian]]| date=19 December 2017| deadurl=no| archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171219151725/https://www.theguardian.com/world/2017/dec/19/jeremy-corbyn-leads-criticism-of-paradise-papers-legal-action| archivedate=19 December 2017| df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== Ukraine ==== [[File:Secretary Tillerson and Ukrainian President Poroshenko Shake Hands Before Their Meeting in Washington (34621629283).jpg|thumb|Ukrainian President [[Petro Poroshenko]] and U.S. Secretary of State [[Rex Tillerson]]]] Ukrainian President [[Petro Poroshenko]] is named in the papers.<ref>{{cite web|title=Paradise Papers Reveal Poroshenko's Attempt to Avoid Ukrainian Taxes|url=https://en.hromadske.ua/posts/paradise-papers-reveal-poroshenkos-attempt-to-avoid-ukrainian-taxes|publisher=Hromadske|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108093724/https://en.hromadske.ua/posts/paradise-papers-reveal-poroshenkos-attempt-to-avoid-ukrainian-taxes|archivedate=8 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> <br> [[Gennadiy Trukhanov]], mayor of Odessa with Russian and Greece citizenships is named as part of a crime gang.<ref>{{cite web|title=Paradise Papers: Ukraine crime gang hid proceeds in luxury London flats|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-43823962|publisher=BBC|date=23 April 2018|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20180424104345/http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-43823962|archivedate=24 April 2018|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
=== Middle East ===
==== Israel ==== Jonathan Kolber, former CEO of Koor Industries and the beneficiary of the Kolber Trust and son of former Canadian senator [[Leo Kolber]], who set the fund up in 1991, is named.<ref name="ParadisePapers1">{{cite news|url=https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/1.821229|title=The Paradise Papers: Haaretz Reveals Some of the Israeli Businessmen and Firms Registered in Offshore Tax Havens|last1=Blau|first1=Uri|date=5 November 2017|work=[[Haaretz]]|accessdate=7 November 2017|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107001725/https://www.haaretz.com/israel-news/1.821229|archivedate=7 November 2017|deadurl=no|authorlink1=Uri Blau|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
[[Dan Gertler]], Israeli billionaire businessman in [[natural resource]]s and the founder and President of the DGI ([[Dan Gertler International]]) Group of Companies appears in 120 documents regarding his relationship with Glencore.<ref name="ParadisePapers1" />
==== Jordan ==== [[Queen Noor of Jordan]] is listed in the papers as the beneficiary of two trusts registered in Jersey.<ref>{{cite web|title=Noor al-Hussein|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|website=[[International Consortium of Investigative Journalists]]|access-date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105182521/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> One of the trusts, the Valentine 1997 Trust, was valued at more than $40 million in 2015, and its income is to be paid to the queen during her lifetime. The trust also owns property in southern England adjacent to [[Buckhurst Park, Sussex]]. The other trust, the Brown Discretionary Settlement, is the beneficial owner of a Jersey-incorporated investment holding company with assets worth c. $18.7 million in 2015.
==== Saudi Arabia ==== Prince [[Khalid bin Sultan|Khaled bin Sultan]] bin Abdulaziz Al Saud, a former deputy minister of defense for the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia, is given as the owner of at least eight companies in Bermuda between 1989 and 2014, some of them apparently formed for purposes of owning yachts and airplanes.<ref name=explore />
==== Syria ==== [[Rami Makhlouf]], reportedly Syria's wealthiest man, is listed in the papers.<ref>{{cite web|work=ICIJ Offshore Leaks Database|url=https://offshoreleaks.icij.org/stories/rami-makhlouf|title=Rami Makhlouf|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107015235/https://offshoreleaks.icij.org/stories/rami-makhlouf|archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
=== North America ===
==== Canada ==== [[File:Jean Chrétien 2010.jpg|thumb|upright|Former Prime Minister of Canada [[Jean Chrétien]]]] Three former Canadian Prime Ministers are named in the Paradise Papers: [[Jean Chrétien]], [[Paul Martin]], and [[Brian Mulroney]].<ref>{{cite web|title=Huge offshore data leak reveals financial secrets of global elites—from the Queen to former PMs|url=http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/paradise-papers-leak-1.4387338|publisher=CBC News|access-date=5 November 2017|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105232749/http://www.cbc.ca/news/business/paradise-papers-leak-1.4387338|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> According to the papers, [[Bronfman family|Stephen Bronfman]], Canadian Prime Minister [[Justin Trudeau]]'s adviser and close friend, a Liberal Party fundraiser credited with putting Trudeau into office, moved millions of dollars offshore for former Liberal Party Senator [[Leo Kolber]].<ref name=KolBronf>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/justin-trudeaus-chief-fundraiser-linked-offshore-tax-maneuvers/|title=Justin Trudeau's Chief Fundraiser Linked To Offshore Tax Maneuvers: Long-standing offshore ties of the Liberal Party moneyman and his famous family provide jarring contrast to Canadian prime minister's campaign for tax fairness.|author1=Harvey Cashore|author2=Ryan Chittum|publisher=ICIJ|date=5 November 2017|accessdate=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106000613/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/justin-trudeaus-chief-fundraiser-linked-offshore-tax-maneuvers/|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The offshore maneuvers may have avoided taxes in Canada, the United States and Israel, according to experts who reviewed some of the 3,000-plus files detailing the trust's activities.<ref name="ICIJ-20171105" />
==== Costa Rica ==== Former president [[José María Figueres]] sat on the board of energy company Energia Global International, along with his brother and Timothy Phillips. The company was bought in 2001 by Enel SpA, an Italian power company, for $73 million, plus $37 million in debt cancellation. Figueres resigned from the board that year, at the annual EF meeting in Davos. He was also CEO of [[World Economic Forum]] from 2000 to 2004, and resigned as a result of allegations he called "unfounded" about $900,000 in consulting fees from a French telecommunications firm.<ref name=explore />
==== Mexico ==== According to the files, trade union leader and politician [[Joaquín Gamboa Pascoe]] had investments worth $15.5 million; other mentioned politicians are [[Pedro Aspe Armella]], [[Alejandro Gertz Manero]], and officials from [[PEMEX]]. High-profile Mexicans in the files include billionaire [[Carlos Slim]],<ref name='A UniR'>[http://www.uniradionoticias.com/noticias/mexico/500636/mexicanos-involucrados-en-paradise-papers.html Mexicanos involucrados en Paradise Papers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107010157/http://www.uniradionoticias.com/noticias/mexico/500636/mexicanos-involucrados-en-paradise-papers.html |date=7 November 2017 }}. ''Agencias'', ''UniRadio Noticias'' 6 November 2017. (in Spanish).</ref> priest [[Marcial Maciel]] known as "the greatest fundraiser of the modern Roman Catholic church",<ref name='A UniR' /> and [[Ricardo Salinas Pliego]].<ref name='A UniR' /> In an interview with ''[[Proceso (magazine)|Proceso]]'', Gertz Manero, formerly National Security Secretary, denied all knowledge of the company, of which he was vice-president, and which was started by his brother, its president.<ref name=explore />
==== United States ==== [[File:Wilbur Ross - 2017.jpg|thumb|upright|The leaked documents revealed that Secretary of Commerce [[Wilbur Ross]] holds stakes in businesses connected to sanctioned [[Russian oligarchs]], which he did not disclose during his confirmation hearings.]]
According to the papers, [[United States Secretary of Commerce]] [[Wilbur Ross]] holds stakes in businesses which deal with Russian oligarchs [[Leonid Mikhelson]] and [[Gennady Timchenko]] who are subject to [[International sanctions during the Ukrainian crisis|U.S. sanctions]],<ref name=bbc /> as well as Russian president [[Vladimir Putin]]'s son-in-law, [[Kirill Shamalov]].<ref name="McIntire">{{cite web|last1=McIntire|first1=Mike|last2=Chavkin|first2=Sasha|last3=Hamilton|first3=Martha M.|title=Commerce Secretary's Offshore Ties to Putin 'Cronies'|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/05/world/wilbur-ross-russia.html|publisher=''The New York Times''|access-date=5 November 2017|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105190610/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/05/world/wilbur-ross-russia.html|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Other members of the [[Presidency of Donald Trump|Trump administration]] that appear in the documents include former [[United States Secretary of State]] [[Rex Tillerson]] and former director of the [[National Economic Council (United States)|National Economic Council]] [[Gary Cohn (investment banker)|Gary D. Cohn]].<ref name="ICIJ-20171105" /><ref name="McIntire" /><ref name="icij_influencers">{{cite web|url=https://projects.icij.org/paradise-papers/the-influencers/#/|title=The Influencers – Paradise Papers|website=ICIJ|access-date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105204543/https://projects.icij.org/paradise-papers/the-influencers/#/|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Offshore ties of more than a dozen Trump advisers, Cabinet members and major donors appear in the leaked data.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/paradise-papers-exposes-donald-trump-russia-links-and-piggy-banks-of-the-wealthiest-1-percent/|title=Offshore Trove Exposes Trump-Russia Links And Piggy Banks Of The Wealthiest 1 Percent|date=5 November 2017|publisher=International Consortium of Investigative Journalists|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105203706/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/paradise-papers-exposes-donald-trump-russia-links-and-piggy-banks-of-the-wealthiest-1-percent/|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Tillerson, while CEO of Exxon Yemen, was a director of a company with a joint venture agreement with a Yemeni state-owned company. He sued when Yemen ended the joint venture and turned over operations to a Yemeni company, and lost. He was still a company director and the offshore company was still active as recently as 2015.<ref name=Tillinf>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/us-president-donald-trumps-influencers|title=Rex Tillerson's Offshore Story|publisher=ICIJ|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171114124547/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/us-president-donald-trumps-influencers/|archivedate=14 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
The documents also revealed that Russian state organizations with ties to Putin pursued between 2009 and 2011 large investments in [[Facebook]] and [[Twitter]] via an intermediary—Russian-American entrepreneur [[Yuri Milner]], who befriended Facebook founder [[Mark Zuckerberg]]<ref>"[https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/kremlin-owned-firms-linked-major-twitter-facebook-investments-icij/ Kremlin-owned Firms Linked to Major Investments in Twitter and Facebook] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107004356/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/kremlin-owned-firms-linked-major-twitter-facebook-investments-icij/ |date=7 November 2017 }}". ''International Consortium of Investigative Journalists – ICIJ.'' 5 November 2017.</ref> and was a business associate of [[Jared Kushner]], [[President of the United States|President]] [[Donald Trump]]'s son-in-law.<ref name="Swaine">{{cite web|last1=Swaine|first1=Jon|last2=Harding|first2=Luke|title=Russia funded Facebook and Twitter investments through Kushner associate|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/05/russia-funded-facebook-twitter-investments-kushner-associate|publisher=''The Guardian''|access-date=5 November 2017|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105181907/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/05/russia-funded-facebook-twitter-investments-kushner-associate|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
American singer [[Madonna (entertainer)|Madonna]], Microsoft co-founder [[Paul Allen]], American billionaire [[George Soros]], founder of [[Open Society Foundations]],<ref>{{cite web|last1=Brooks|first1=David|title='Papers of Paradise': secret financial system of the rich and powerful|url=http://www.jornada.com.mx/ultimas/2017/11/05/2018papeles-del-paraiso2019-el-sistema-financiero-secreto-de-ricos-y-poderosos-1768.html|publisher=La Jornada|location=New York|language=Spanish|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=yes|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107004916/http://www.jornada.com.mx/ultimas/2017/11/05/2018papeles-del-paraiso2019-el-sistema-financiero-secreto-de-ricos-y-poderosos-1768.html|archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> and former [[NATO]] supreme commander in Europe General [[Wesley Clark]] are also named in the papers.<ref>"[http://www.bexpress.com.pk/2017/11/trumps-cabinet-members-amongst-those-named-in-paradise-papers/ Trump’s cabinet members amongst those named in Paradise Papers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107005018/http://www.bexpress.com.pk/2017/11/trumps-cabinet-members-amongst-those-named-in-paradise-papers/ |date=7 November 2017 }}". ''Daily Balochistan Express.'' 6 November 2017.</ref>
This list includes some of President Donald Trump's foremost donors, who together funneled nearly $60 million to organizations supporting his campaign and transition. They include casino magnate [[Sheldon Adelson]]; resort owner [[Steve Wynn]]; hedge fund managers [[Robert Mercer (businessman)|Robert Mercer]] and [[Paul Singer (businessman)|Paul Singer]]; and private equity investors [[Tom Barrack]], [[Stephen Schwarzman]], and [[Carl Icahn]].
Prominent Democratic donors also appear in the law firm's files. Questions have arisen about [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic Party]] donor [[Penny Pritzker]]'s compliance with federal ethics rules. She had pledged to divest from more than 200 firms when she was confirmed as President Barack Obama's commerce secretary in 2013, but records show that she transferred [[assets]] to a company owned by her children's [[trust law|trust]]s, which shared the same address as her office.<ref name=donor>{{cite web|title=Big U.S. Political Donors Play The Offshore Game|publisher=ICIJ|date=7 November 2017|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/us-political-donors-play-offshore-game/|author=Spencer Woodman|accessdate=12 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171114124539/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/us-political-donors-play-offshore-game/|archivedate=14 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Economist [[Gabriel Zucman]] and his colleagues estimate that 63% of foreign profits made by American multinational corporations are stored in subsidiaries and offshore accounts, depriving the country of about $70 billion in tax revenue each year.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/12/opinion/paradise-papers-republicans-taxes.html|title=Paradise Papers Show How Misguided the G.O.P. Is on Taxes|author=Bryce Covert|date=November 12, 2017|publisher=New York Times|accessdate=November 18, 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171118071111/https://www.nytimes.com/2017/11/12/opinion/paradise-papers-republicans-taxes.html|archivedate=18 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
=== South America ===
==== Argentina ==== Argentine Finance Minister [[Luis Caputo]] managed at least two [[Offshore bank|offshore]] [[Wealth management|wealth funds]].<ref name=perfil>{{cite web|url=http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-salpico-al-gobierno-de-macri-el-ministro-luis-caputo-manejo-inversiones-en-islas-caiman.phtml|title=Paradise Papers salpicó al Gobierno de Macri: el ministro Luis Caputo manejó inversiones en Islas Caimán|work=Peril|date=5 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171105215607/http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-salpico-al-gobierno-de-macri-el-ministro-luis-caputo-manejo-inversiones-en-islas-caiman.phtml|archivedate=5 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Neither firm, the [[Cayman Islands]]–based Alto Global Fund, nor its [[Miami]]-based parent company Noctua Partners LLC, were listed in Caputo's financial disclosure statement, a statement that all public officials and candidates for office are required to make.<ref name=perfil /> Caputo is a first cousin of local industrialist and construction tycoon Nicolás Caputo, best friend of Argentine President [[Mauricio Macri]]. He told Argentine members of the ICIJ team that "it was an investment fund for friends and family."<ref name=perfil /> The funds, opened in 2009 and with over $100 million under management, remained under Caputo's management until December 2015, when Macri named him Finance Secretary, a post upgraded to Finance Minister this January.<ref name=perfil />
Argentine Energy Minister [[Juan José Aranguren]] managed two offshore companies, Shell Western Supply and Trading Limited and Sol Antilles y Guianas Limited, both subsidiaries of [[Royal Dutch Shell]]. One is the main bidder for the purchase of diesel oil by the current government through the state owned CAMMESA (Compañía Administradora del Mercado Mayorista Eléctrico).<ref name="perfil1">{{cite news|title=Aranguren: su paso por una offshore de Shell a la que el Estado le compró gasoil por US$ 150 M|url=http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-aranguren-su-paso-por-una-offshore-de-shell-a-la-que-el-estado-le-compro-gasoil-por-us-150-m.phtml|accessdate=7 November 2017|work=[[Perfil]]|date=7 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107155244/http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/paradise-papers-aranguren-su-paso-por-una-offshore-de-shell-a-la-que-el-estado-le-compro-gasoil-por-us-150-m.phtml|archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
According to the papers, Argentine hotelier and real estate developer [[Alan Faena]] was director and CEO of half a dozen companies in the [[Cayman Islands]] and [[British Virgin Islands]]. Faena also appears with bank accounts in [[Luxembourg]] and the [[Isle of Man]], linked to different hotels and real estate projects in [[Puerto Madero]]. In the offshore firms he was associated with different investors such as Soviet-born British-American businessman [[Leonard Blavatnik]]; American billionaire [[J. Christopher Burch]] and his brother Robert Burch; American business and media executive [[John Augustine Hearst]]; and French designer [[Philippe Starck]].<ref>{{cite news|title=Alan Faena, otro argentino en Paradise Papers|url=http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/alan-faena-otro-argentino-en-paradise-papers-firmas-offshore-y-cuentas-en-suiza-y-luxemburgo.phtml|accessdate=7 November 2017|work=[[Perfil]]|date=7 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171107213019/http://www.perfil.com/paradisepapers/alan-faena-otro-argentino-en-paradise-papers-firmas-offshore-y-cuentas-en-suiza-y-luxemburgo.phtml|archivedate=7 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
==== Brazil ==== {{See also|Operation Car Wash| Corruption in Brazil|Petrobras}} Agriculture Minister [[Blairo Maggi|Blairo Borges Maggi]] is mentioned in the papers.<ref name=explore>{{cite web|url=https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|title=Explore The Politicians in the Paradise Papers|publisher=ICIJ|accessdate=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106011937/https://www.icij.org/investigations/paradise-papers/explore-politicians-paradise-papers/|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> His company, Amaggi and LD Commodities, was first registered about five months after Maggi ended a term as governor of [[Mato Grosso]]. Maggi told Brazilian outlet ''Poder360'' that he was not a direct beneficiary of the company and he had never received money from it.
[[Henrique Meirelles|Henrique de Campos Meirelles]], the current Brazilian Minister of Finance, told ''[[Poder360]]'' that he does not report income from his Sabedoria Foundation because it was set up to perform charitable functions after his death and therefore he receives no income from it.<ref name=explore />
==== Chile ==== Alsacia-Express, which runs the debt-ridden public transit system of [[Santiago]], holds assets in a Bermuda bank, according to the Appleby documents.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://ciperchile.cl/2017/11/07/alsacia-express-los-secretos-en-islas-bermudas-del-mayor-operador-del-transantiago/ |publisher=Ciper |title=Alsacia Express: Los secretos en Islas Bermudas del mayor operador del Transantiago |date=November 7, 2017 |accessdate=November 26, 2017 |language=es |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171201044510/http://ciperchile.cl/2017/11/07/alsacia-express-los-secretos-en-islas-bermudas-del-mayor-operador-del-transantiago/ |archivedate=1 December 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
==== Colombia ==== [[File:Juan Manuel Santos Calderón - World Economic Forum on Latin America 2010.jpg|thumb|Colombian President [[Juan Manuel Santos]]]] President of [[Colombia]] (2010–2018) [[Juan Manuel Santos]] is mentioned in the investigation. He was part of two offshore societies.<ref>"[http://www.elmundo.es/internacional/2017/11/05/59ff586f22601dea7f8b460c.html Juan Manuel Santos, el yerno de Trump y la reina Isabel II, implicados en los Paradise Papers] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108023135/http://www.elmundo.es/internacional/2017/11/05/59ff586f22601dea7f8b460c.html |date=8 November 2017 }}". ''El Mundo.'' 5 November 2017.</ref>
The singer [[Shakira]], while living in [[Barcelona]], is a resident of the Bahamas and sends her [[authors' rights]] revenue to Malta.<ref>{{Cite news|url=http://www.lemonde.fr/paradise-papers/article/2017/11/07/la-chanteuse-shakira-place-des-millions-d-euros-de-droits-d-auteur-a-malte_5211594_5209585.html|title=La chanteuse Shakira place des millions d'euros de droits d'auteur à Malte|date=7 November 2017|work=Le Monde.fr|access-date=8 November 2017|language=fr|issn=1950-6244}}</ref>
== Public reaction == In the United Kingdom, the public reaction to the Paradise Papers has been relatively muted compared to similar leaks in the past, such as the [[Panama Papers]].<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/nov/10/protest-paradise-papers-micah-white |title=Why aren't the streets full of protest about the Paradise Papers? |publisher=''[[The Guardian]]'' |author=Micah White |date=10 November 2017 |accessdate=10 November 2017 |quote=The street-level response to the Paradise Papers, the mighty follow-up punch to last year's Panama Papers, has been curiously tepid. This is probably not what many activists, and the 100 media organizations involved in the leak, expected to happen. |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171110124851/https://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2017/nov/10/protest-paradise-papers-micah-white |archivedate=10 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Possible reasons include the absence of overt illegality in the information; most media sources are careful to point out that the schemes in the Paradise Papers are generally lawful.<ref>{{cite web |url=http://www.scotsman.com/news/bill-jamieson-is-it-so-bad-to-avoid-tax-within-the-law-1-4608429 |title=Bill Jamieson: is it so bad to avoid tax within the law? |publisher=''[[The Scotsman]]'' |author=Bill Jamieson |date=9 November 2017 |accessdate=10 November 2017 |quote=Arguably most puzzling of all was the exact nature of the wrong doing. Both the Paradise Papers website and the BBC Panorama documentary ... repeatedly stressed that no laws had been broken and that UK tax due had been paid. Indeed, as the BBC documentary made clear, "the vast majority of the transactions involve no legal wrongdoing". |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109111745/http://www.scotsman.com/news/bill-jamieson-is-it-so-bad-to-avoid-tax-within-the-law-1-4608429 |archivedate=9 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> A statement on behalf of Queen Elizabeth confirmed that the Royal Estate paid full UK tax on her offshore investments.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41878305|title=Paradise Papers: Queen's private estate invested £10m in offshore funds|publisher=BBC News|author=|date=6 November 2017|accessdate=10 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106011244/http://www.bbc.com/news/uk-41878305|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> Other public comments by notable popular public figures who appeared in the Papers may also play a part; Bono stated "I've been assured by those running the company that it is fully tax compliant, but if that is not the case, I want to know as much as the tax office does, and so I also welcome the audit they have said they will undertake."<ref>{{cite web |url=https://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/bono-paradise-papers-u2-tax-offshore-investment-guernsey-malta-shopping-mall-statement-latest-a8044541.html |title=Paradise Papers: Bono says he welcomes investigation into offshore investment |publisher=''[[The Independent]]'' |author=Roisin O'Connor |date=9 November 2017 |accessdate=10 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171108213035/http://www.independent.co.uk/arts-entertainment/music/news/bono-paradise-papers-u2-tax-offshore-investment-guernsey-malta-shopping-mall-statement-latest-a8044541.html |archivedate=8 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> Jack Peat has suggested that much of the media has ignored the story of the Paradise Papers because those media organisations are owned by individuals implicated in the papers, such as ''[[Daily Telegraph]]'' owners [[Barclay brothers|David and Frederick Barclay]], ''[[Daily Mail]]'' owner [[Jonathan Harmsworth]], and ''[[The Sun (United Kingdom)|The Sun]]'' and ''[[The Times]]'' owner [[Rupert Murdoch]].<ref>{{cite news |last=Peat |first=Jack |date=7 November 2017 |title=This is why there's been so little media coverage of the Paradise Papers |url=https://www.thelondoneconomic.com/news/theres-little-media-coverage-paradise-papers/07/11/ |work=The London Economic |access-date=12 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171113113109/https://www.thelondoneconomic.com/news/theres-little-media-coverage-paradise-papers/07/11/ |archivedate=13 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref>
After the leak, more than 30 [[Members of the European Parliament]] issued an open letter criticizing the British government for failing to take action against the offshore tax industry.<ref>{{cite news|last1=Osborne|first1=Hilary|last2=MacAskill|first2=Ewen|title=Britain criticised by MEPs for failing to take action on tax havens|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/10/britain-criticised-meps-action-tax-havens-paradise-papers|accessdate=10 November 2017|work=[[The Guardian]]|date=10 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171110143004/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/10/britain-criticised-meps-action-tax-havens-paradise-papers|archivedate=10 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
[[Gavin St Pier]], an elected Deputy of the tax haven [[Guernsey]], stated that the "coverage was part of a well-orchestrated, ongoing campaign".<ref name=GStP>{{cite web |url=https://www.ft.com/content/38e99534-c48e-11e7-a1d2-6786f39ef675 |title=Paradise Papers shake Britain's offshore tax havens |publisher=''Financial Times'' |author=Vanessa Houlder |date=8 November 2017 |accessdate=8 November 2017 |deadurl=no |archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171109172213/https://www.ft.com/content/38e99534-c48e-11e7-a1d2-6786f39ef675 |archivedate=9 November 2017 |df=dmy-all }}</ref> He also averred that despite having the information since 2016, the timing of the release was deliberately delayed to coincide with the meeting of EU Finance Ministers ahead of the proposed discussion of a tax haven blacklist.<ref name=GStP />
Commenting on the Paradise Papers leak, United States Senator and 2016 presidential candidate [[Bernie Sanders]] warned of "rapid movement toward international oligarchy", saying, "The Paradise Papers shows how these billionaires and multinational corporations get richer by hiding their wealth and profits and avoid paying their fair share of taxes."<ref name=Sanders>{{cite web|url=https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/06/bernie-sanders-paradise-papers-leak-international-oligarchy|title=Bernie Sanders warns of 'international oligarchy' after Paradise Papers leak|publisher=''The Guardian''|accessdate=6 November 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171106190738/https://www.theguardian.com/news/2017/nov/06/bernie-sanders-paradise-papers-leak-international-oligarchy|archivedate=6 November 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref> The [[Democratic Party (United States)|Democratic]] leader in the US Senate, [[Chuck Schumer]], and the ranking Democratic member of the Senate finance committee, [[Ron Wyden]], issued a joint statement accusing Republicans of "pushing a reform of the tax code that fails to close egregious loopholes revealed by the leaks."<ref name=Sanders />
==Litigation== On 18 December 2017 it was reported that Appleby had issued legal proceedings against the BBC and ''The Guardian'' for [[Breach of confidence in English law|breach of confidence]]. The BBC and ''The Guardian'' said they would "vigorously" defend the action.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-42403700|title=BBC and Guardian sued over Paradise Papers leaks|publisher=BBC News|date=18 December 2017|accessdate=24 December 2017|deadurl=no|archiveurl=https://web.archive.org/web/20171221174814/http://www.bbc.co.uk/news/uk-42403700|archivedate=21 December 2017|df=dmy-all}}</ref>
Appleby released a media statement to explain the necessity to seek legal action,<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.applebyglobal.com/media-statements/appleby-takes-legal-action.aspx|title=Appleby Media Statement|publisher=States of Jersey|date=20 December 2017|accessdate=20 December 2017}}</ref> and provided subsequent update.<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.applebyglobal.com/media-statements/why-appleby-is-taking-legal-action-against-the-guardian-and-the-bbc.aspx|title=Appleby Media Statement|publisher=States of Jersey|date=26 January 2018|accessdate=26 January 2018}}</ref> ''The Guardian'' and the BBC settled the dispute with Appleby in May 2018.<ref>{{cite news |last=Tobitt |first=Charlotte |url=http://www.pressgazette.co.uk/guardian-and-bbc-settle-paradise-papers-dispute-with-offshore-law-firm-appleby/ |title=Guardian and BBC settle Paradise Papers dispute with offshore law firm Appleby |work=Press Gazette |date=22 May 2018 |accessdate=1 June 2018}}</ref>
In October 2018, Swiss-based multinational [[Glencore]] lodged a writ with the Australian High Court to prevent the use of Paradise Papers documents by the Australian Taxation Office in any legal action against the miner. Glencore asserted that the documents in question are subject to legal professional privilege. Glencore’s writ has four plaintiffs: Glencore International AG (an intermediate holding company resident in Switzerland), Glencore Investment Pty Ltd (a company incorporated in Australia), Glencore Australia Holdings Pty Ltd (a company incorporated in Australia) and Glencore Investment Holdings Australia Ltd (a company incorporated in Bermuda).<ref>{{cite web|url=https://www.msn.com/en-gb/finance/news/glencore-seeks-injunction-against-tax-commissioner-to-prevent-use-of-paradise-papers/ar-BBNRXEJ|title=Glencore seeks injunction against tax commissioner to prevent use of Paradise Papers|publisher=The Guardian|date=4 October 2018|accessdate=9 October 2018}}</ref>

The '''Registered Professional Accountant (RPA)''' is a [[Canada|Canadian]] [[accounting]] designation granted by the Society of Professional Accountants of Canada (SPAC). The designation requires passing a set of four exams including [[Taxation]], Accounting, [[Finance]] and [[Auditing]] and a completion of University or College courses set by the Society.
Direct admission as a RPA into the society is also offered to those holding recognized accounting designations including the CMA, CGA, CA and CPA.
The RPA qualifies to act as a Canadian [[passport]] guarantor and is recognized for admission as an associate member to the [[Institute of Certified Management Accountants]] of [[Australia]]. RPAs are also eligible to write the Forensic Certified Public Accountant exam offered by the Forensic CPA Society in the state of [[Washington (state)|Washington]] [[United States|USA]].
The RPA designation is recognized by the Ontario Civil service, Ministry of Education and Training Ontario and Management Board of Cabinet of Ontario for [[employment]] purposes.
The RPA designation is not as well known as the CGA, CMA and CA designations in Canada due to its limited number of members. These three accounting designations are in advanced discussions to unify as [[Chartered Professional Accountants of Canada (CPA Canada)]].<ref>http://www.taxclinic.ca/tax-tips/2013/01/05/cpa-canada</ref> However, SPAC is currently under negotiations with other small accounting associations in Canada for a possible [[merger]] that can help to increase numbers and market acceptability.

[[File:Hilbers, Reinhold.jpg|260px|right]] '''Reinhold Hilbers''' (born 25 July 1964 in [[Lingen, Germany|Lingen]]) is a [[Germany|German]] [[businessman]] and [[politician]], representative of the [[Christian Democratic Union (Germany)|German Christian Democratic Union]]. He has been a member of the [[Landtag of Lower Saxony]] since March 2003. Since November 2017, he has been serving as State Minister of Finance in the government of Minister-President [[Stephan Weil]].
==Early life and career== After training in the wholesale and export business, he undertook [[military service]] in the Bundeswehr. Then, he studied economics at the [[University of Osnabrück]]. Between 1993 and 1999, he worked at a local bank. From 1999 he served as managing director of Lebenshilfe Nordhorn GmbH.<ref>{{cite web|url=http://reinhold-hilbers.de/zur-person/|title=Zur Person|publisher=reinhold-hilbers.de|accessdate=27 August 2009}}</ref>
==Political career== Hilbers became a member of the CDU in 1988. At present he is chairman of the CDU district of [[Grafschaft Bentheim]].
Since the [[Lower Saxony state election, 2003|2003 state elections]], Hilbers has been a member of the State Parliament of Lower Saxony. He was elected with 72.2% of the votes to represent his constituency in parliament. In the [[Lower Saxony state election, 2008|2008 state elections]], he obtained 55.6% of the votes. From 2013 until 2017, he served as deputy chairman of the CDU parliamentary group.
In 2017, [[Bernd Althusmann]] included Hilbers in his [[shadow cabinet]] for the Christian Democrats’ campaign to unseat incumbent Minister-President [[Stephan Weil]]; during the campaign, he was in charge of social policy issues. Hilbers eventually become State Minister of Finance. In this capacity, he is one of the state's representatives at the [[Bundesrat of Germany|Bundesrat]], where he serves on the Finance Committee.
==Other activities== ===Regulatory agencies=== * [[Stabilitätsrat (Germany)|Stability Council]], Ex-Officio Member<ref>[http://www.stabilitaetsrat.de/EN/Organisation/Vorsitz-und-Mitglieder/Vorsitz-und-Mitglieder_node.html Chair and Members] [[Stabilitätsrat (Germany)|Stability Council]].</ref> ===Corporate boards=== * [[Deutsche Messe AG]], Member of the Advisory Board * Bentheimer Eisenbahn AG, Chairman of the Supervisory Board (since 2017) * [[KfW]], Member of the Board of Supervisory Directors<ref>[https://www.kfw.de/KfW-Group/About-KfW/Vorstand-und-Gremien/Verwaltungsrat-und-seine-Aussch%C3%BCsse/ Board of Supervisory Directors and its Committees] [[KfW]].</ref> * [[Norddeutsche Landesbank]] (NORD/LB), Ex-Officio Chairman of the Supervisory Board (since 2017),<ref>[https://www.stk.niedersachsen.de/aktuelles/presseinformationen/minister-reinhold-hilbers-ist-vorsitzender-des-aufsichtsrates-der-nordlb--159836.html Minister Reinhold Hilbers ist Vorsitzender des Aufsichtsrates der Nord/LB] Government of Lower Saxony, press release of November 29, 2017.</ref> previously Member of the Advisory Board<ref>[https://www.nordlb.de/fileadmin/redaktion/branchen/investorrelations/geschaeftsberichte/2016/Geschaeftsbericht_2016.pdf 2016 Annual Report] [[Norddeutsche Landesbank]] (NORD/LB).</ref> * [[Salzgitter AG]], Ex-Officio Member of the Supervisory Board<ref>[https://www.stk.niedersachsen.de/aktuelles/presseinformationen/minister-reinhold-hilbers-nimmt-aufsichtsratsmandat-bei-der-salzgitter-ag-wahr--160226.html Minister Reinhold Hilbers nimmt Aufsichtsratsmandat bei der Salzgitter AG wahr] Government of Lower Saxony, press release of December 12, 2017.</ref>

{{Use dmy dates|date=April 2018}} {{Use British English|date=April 2018}} '''Roger Evernden''' (born ca. 1954) is a British enterprise architect, musician, composer, writer and speaker.
As an enterprise architect he is a consultant at the [[Cutter Consortium]], known as author of the [[Information FrameWork]], an [[enterprise architecture framework]] presented in 1996 as more generic alternative to the [[Zachman Framework]].<ref>Rik Maes. ''[http://imwww.fee.uva.nl/~pv/PDFdocs/99-03.pdf A generic framework for information management] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20120911162856/http://imwww.fee.uva.nl/~pv/PDFdocs/99-03.pdf |date=2012-09-11 }}.'' Universiteit van Amsterdam, Department of Accountancy & Information Management, 1999.</ref><ref>[[Greefhorst, Danny]], Henk Koning, and [[Hans van Vliet]]. "The many faces of architectural descriptions." Information Systems Frontiers 8.2 (2006): 103-113.</ref>
As a musician and composer he is best known for his [[new-age music]] solo piano albums - "Improvation" released in 2014<ref>{{cite web |last1=Evernden |first1=Roger |title=Improvation |url=https://play.google.com/store/music/album/Roger_Evernden_Improvation?id=Bv2jek55vlvg3gm2dxlf7gv4gya}}</ref> and "The Journey We All Make" in 2016.<ref>{{cite web |last1=Evernden |first1=Roger |title=The Journey We All Make |url=https://play.google.com/store/music/album/Roger_Evernden_The_Journey_We_All_Make?id=Btxxm65haxv5m4x4wwhvwsi3xuu |accessdate=31 July 2018}}</ref><ref>{{cite web |last1=Parsons |first1=Kathy |title=Review: The Journey We All Make |url=https://mainlypiano.com/reviews/roger-evernden-the-journey-we-all-make |accessdate=31 July 2018}}</ref>
== Biography == Evernden received his BA in History at the [[Lancaster University]] in 1975, and a Post-Graduate Certificate in Education at the Goldsmiths' College of the [[University of London]] in 1977.
Evernden started his career as history teacher in London in 1977. In 1980 he started working in IT as analyst and programmer, and worked his way up from consultant and application developer to enterprise architect working for companies as [[Legal & General]], [[IBM]], [[Westpac Banking Corporation]], and smaller companies. From 2007 to 2011 he was Enterprise Domain Architect and later Enterprise Architect at [[Lloyds Bank]]. Since 2011 he is Senior Consultant with Cutter Consortium's Business & Enterprise Architecture practice,
== Work == === Information FrameWork (IFW) === In the late 1980s Evernden developed [[Information FrameWork]] (IFW) to describe an enterprise architect initiative at [[Westpac]]. This was later described in an IBM Systems Journal article, published in 1996. The Westpac project - known internally as CS90, or Core Systems for the 1990s - was a prototype for using enterprise architecture to create adaptive organizations or adaptive systems. The Westpac experience was described by [[Stephan H. Haeckel]] - an American management theorist and former director of Strategic Studies at IBM’s Advanced Business Institute - who developed the idea of the sense-and-respond organization as an adaptive enterprise.
The Information FrameWork (IFW) was presented in 1996 as framework for Information management, and more generic alternative to the Zachman Framework. Evernden (1996) explained: :''the objectives and scope of IFW are broader than that of the original Zachman framework. IFW is described and compared with the original Zachman structure, showing the evolution, changes, and the rationale behind the changes based on experiences from within the financial services industry.''<ref name="E 1996">Evernden (1996, p. 37)</ref> In his 1996 paper Evernden also showed "how the structure of IFW has been populated by industry-wide models and supported by a distinctive methodology. A detailed discussion of each of the six dimensions of the IFW architecture is presented."<ref name="E 1996"/>
=== Other works === Evernden is co-author, with Elaine Evernden, of ''Information First: Integrating Knowledge and Information Architecture for Business Advantage'', which was first published in 2003, expanding the concepts of Information FrameWork (IFW). ''Information First'' outlines an approach to [[enterprise architecture]] that uses eight factors common to all [[enterprise architecture framework]]s that can be combined to create architectural tools for managing enterprise and [[business transformation]].A 2nd edition was published in 2015 with the title: ''Enterprise Architecture - the Eight Fundamental Factors.''
In 2008, at the height of the [[financial crisis of 2007–2008]], he spoke about how [[enterprise architecture]] could be used to weather unpredictable events.<ref>[http://www.irmuk.co.uk/eac2008/speakers.htm#Evernden Weathering the Perfect Storm with Enterprise Architecture]</ref> In 2011 he described the architectural approach to create a single integrated IT platform from two heritage banking systems following the Lloyds TSB acquisition of HBOS to form Lloyds Banking Group January 2009.<ref>[http://www.irmuk.co.uk/eac2011/day1.cfm#Day1-S6 A LEAP in the Dark: The UK's Biggest Banking Integration Programme]</ref>
In 2017 he presented a case study at Vesta Corporation describing a combination of online training and webinars in a nine-month program to build the capabilities and confidence of their enterprise architecture team.<ref>[https://irmuk.co.uk/events/enterprise-architecture-conference-europe/#session-59 Mentoring an EA Team: A Case Study at Vesta Corporation]</ref>
== Selected publications == * Evernden, Roger. "[http://dl.acm.org/citation.cfm?id=1011358 The information framework]." ''IBM Systems Journal'' 35.1 (1996): 37-68. * Evernden, Roger, Information FrameWork (IFW): 1996 Systems Journal Article and 2011 Update, 2018<ref>{{cite book |last1=Evernden |first1=Roger |title=Information FrameWork (IFW): 1996 Systems Journal Article and 2011 Update |date=10 March 2018 |publisher=Jubal Promotions |pages=192 |url=http://amzn.eu/9747bn0}}</ref> * Elaine Evernden, Roger Evernden. ''Information First.'' Elsevier, 2003/2012. * Elaine Evernden, Roger Evernden. ''Enterprise Architecture - the Eight Fundamental Factors.'' CreateSpace, 2015, {{ISBN|1517364361}}<ref>{{cite book |last1=Evernden |first1=Roger |title=Enterprise Architecture - the Eight Fundamental Factors |date=2015 |publisher=CreateSpace |isbn=1517364361 |pages=303 |edition=2nd |url=http://amzn.eu/gYYPXUA |accessdate=31 July 2018}}</ref> * Evernden, Roger, and Elaine Evernden. "[http://www.cs.jyu.fi/el/tjtse25_11/TJTSE25_Syllabus_files/p95-evernden.pdf Third-generation information architecture]." ''Communications of the ACM'' 46.3 (2003): 95-98. * Evernden, R. ''[http://www.cutter.com/content/architecture/fulltext/reports/2013/01/index.html Mastering Complexity to Drive EA Productivity]'', Cutter Consortium Executive Report, Vol. 16, No. 1, 2013
== Discography == * 1990: [https://open.spotify.com/album/55FgJbXWEEFoVHuOxFcZdr?si=oFIhhZ0NQbGb6lKGy4mhGQ Glebe] ([[New Age]]) * 2014: [https://open.spotify.com/album/29ZfuqaXkB833B2D6vNO8C?si=dLvGFUGvTnqxoNq-s3pQBA Improvation] (Solo Piano) * 2016: [https://open.spotify.com/album/0CZCMDq4DTt58ozDmgZh09?si=zbSdgEGZT0GQNHRCyp5DHg The Journey We All Make] (Solo Piano)

'''Institution in the United Kingdom'''
{{small|([[Master of Business Administration]])}} | occupation = [[Politician]], [[Businesswoman]] | years_active = 2012 — present | nationality = Rwandan | ethnicity = | citizenship = Rwandan | residence = [[Kigali]], [[Rwanda]] | known_for = Politics | networth = | home_town = | title = Cabinet Minister for Youth, in the [[Cabinet of Rwanda]] | spouse = | religion = }} '''Rosmary Mbabazi''', is a businesswoman and politician in [[Rwanda]], who has served as the Cabinet Minister for Youth in the [[Cabinet of Rwanda|Rwandan cabinet]], since 31 August 2017.{{cite web|last=Kagire | url=http://www.theeastafrican.co.ke/news/Rwanda-Kagame-cabinet-women/2558-4077764-71yir9z/index.html |title=Women make up more than half of Kagame’s new Cabinet |accessdate=1 September 2017 | date=31 August 2017 | newspaper=[[The EastAfrican]] |location=Nairobi |first=Edmund}} ==Background and education== Mbabazi holds a bachelors degree in Education, obtained from [[Makerere University]], in Kampala, [[Uganda]]. She also holds a [[Master of Business Administration]], from an institution in the [[United Kingdom]].{{cite web|url=http://www.myict.gov.rw/mbabazi-rosemary/ | title=Mbabazi Rosemary |publisher=Rwanda Ministry of Youth & ICT (MYICT)| author=MYICT |location=Kigali | accessdate=1 September 2017 | date=2016}} ==Career== From 2009 until 2011 she served as the Head of the investment promotion department in the [[Rwanda Development Board]]. In 2011, Rosemary Mbabazi was appointed a caretaker of Umubano Hotel and the chairperson of Soprotel, a joint venture company between governments of Rwanda and Libya. In February 2012, she was appointed the Permanent Secretary in the Ministry of Youth and ICT, serving n that capacity until February 2017, when she was transferred to the Rwanda Ministry of Trade, Industry and East African Community Affairs (MINEACOM), as the permanent secretary.{{cite web| url=http://mineacom.gov.rw/index.php?id=71&tx_ttnews[tt_news]=980&cHash=6f2d6d90828174212698dbca009b8757 | title=Innocent Safari outgoing Permanent Secretary handed over office to Rosemary Mbabazi | accessdate=1 September 2017 |date=7 February 2017 | location=Kigali |publisher=Rwanda Ministry of Trade, Industry and East African Community Affairs (MINEACOM) | author=MINEACOM}} In the cabinet reshuffle of 31 August 2017, Mbabazi was appointed the cabinet minister for the newly created Ministry of Youth, the former Ministry of Youth and ICT, having been split into two dockets.{{cite web|url=http://www.newtimes.co.rw/section/read/219033/ | title=Rwanda gets new Cabinet, who is in? | accessdate=1 September 2017 |last=Kimenyi | first=Felly | date=31 August 2017 | newspaper=[[New Times (Rwanda)]]| location=Kigali}} ==Other responsibilities== Rosemary Mbabazi has previously served as a member of the [[board of directors]] of [http://www.rra.gov.rw/ Rwanda Revenue Authority].{{cite web|url=http://www.rra.gov.rw/index.php?id=74 | title=Rwanda Revenue Authority: Board of Directors |accessdate=1 September 2017 | location=Kigali| publisher=Rwanda Revenue Authority (RRA) |author=RRA |date=2017}} ==See also== *[[Judith Uwizeye]] ==References== {{reflist}} ==External links== *[http://www.rdb.rw/home.html Website of Rwanda Development Board] {{DEFAULTSORT:Mbabazi, Rosemary}} [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:Government ministers of Rwanda]] [[Category:Makerere University alumni]] [[Category:Rwandan businesspeople]] [[Category:Rwandan women in business]] [[Category:Women government ministers of Rwanda]] [[Category:21st-century women politicians]] [[Category:21st-century businesswomen]] [[Category:Year of birth missing (living people)]] {{Rwanda-bio-stub}}

'''SME Global''' is a think tank and a network of politicians, who are members of the [[International Democrat Union]]. It provides an institutional framework for [[small and medium sized enterprises]] (SMEs) at the international level.<ref>[http://www.idu.org/sme_union.aspx SME Global] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130909223457/http://www.idu.org/sme_union.aspx |date=2013-09-09 }}, International Democrat Union, retrieved on 13 April 2013.</ref> It was founded in 2003 by its current president, European Parliament member [[Paul Rübig]].<ref>[http://www.sme-global.info Homepage], SME Global, retrieved on 13 April 2013.</ref> Other key members are former Prime Minister of Australia [[John Howard]], former US Congressman [[Don Manzullo]] and former Slovak Finance Minister [[Ivan Miklos]].<ref>[http://www.sme-global.info/the-board Board Composition] {{webarchive|url=https://web.archive.org/web/20130929084031/http://www.sme-global.info/the-board |date=2013-09-29 }}, SME Global, retrieved on 13 April 2013.</ref>

{{Use mdy dates|date=June 2011}} {{Infobox person | name = Samba Bathily | image = President Conde0049+.jpg | birth_date = {{birth date and age|1971|10|23|df=y}} | birth_place = [[Bamako]], [[Mali]] | occupation = Co-Founder of [[Akon Lighting Africa]]
Chief Executive Officer of Solektra International }} '''Samba Bathily''' is a [[Mali]]an [[entrepreneur]], [[philanthropist]] from [[Bamako]]. He is also [[chief executive officer]] of “Solektra International” and co-founder of [[Akon Lighting Africa]]. ==Career == In 2014, Samba co-founded [[Akon Lighting Africa]]. This was launched with international music star Akon and Thione Niang.{{cite web|url=https://blogs.wsj.com/frontiers/2015/05/20/singer-akon-makes-progress-with-african-solar-power-venture/|title=Singer Akon Makes Progress With African Solar Power Venture|date=2015-05-20|accessdate=2015-09-23}} The objective of this initiative is to bring awareness around the use of solar solutions to provide villages throughout Africa with access to clean, renewable and reliable electricity. To date, results include a series of solar developments such as the installation of street lamps and domestic and community modern renewable energy solutions in 14 countries throughout Africa.{{cite web|url=https://www.youtube.com/watch?t=17&v=MFPxL-Nz7fk|title=CNBC Africa - Akon to electrify Africa|date=2015-08-19|accessdate=2015-09-23}} Also launched in 2014 was Solektra International, a company that specializes in the planning, design, construction and maintenance of solar power systems. Samba is CEO and Co-founder with Akon and Thione Niang.{{cite web|url=http://solektra-international.com/management-team/samba-bathily-profile/|title=Samba Bathily|date=2015|accessdate=2015-09-22}} Solektra has a B2G (Business to Government) financing model that offers attractive and affordable repayment terms. Solektra International is the execution arm of Akon Lighting Africa with a goal to use local youths to implement projects while also fast tracking the social and economic development of Africa in cooperation with various international partners. Solektra International currently has a presence in 14 countries - [[Mali]], [[Senegal]], [[Niger]], [[Benin]], [[Sierra Leone]], [[Burkina-Faso]], [[Guinea]], [[Equatorial Guinea]], [[Gabon]], [[Congo-Brazzaville]], [[Nigeria]], [[Madagascar]], [[Namibia]]. Samba is soon to launch the “Solektra Solar Academy” to provide a pipeline of trained youth where they will develop skills and expertise in the field of solar energy. To be launched late 2015, this professional training institute targets future African entrepreneurs, engineers and technicians and will provide training on aspects of planning, design, construction and the maintenance of solar-powered electric systems and micro-grids.{{cite web|url=http://www.huffingtonpost.co.uk/2015/06/03/akon-lighting-africa-to-bring-electricity-to-600-million-_n_7500156.html|title=Akon Lighting Africa's Solar Academy Hopes To Bring Electricity To 600 Million People|date=2015-03-06|accessdate=2015-09-23}} ==References== {{Reflist|30em}} {{DEFAULTSORT:Bathily, Samba}} [[Category:Malian businesspeople]] [[Category:Philanthropists]] [[Category:1971 births]] [[Category:Living people]] [[Category:People from Bamako]] [[Category:Université catholique de Louvain alumni]] [[Category:Malian expatriates in Belgium]]
